Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole hit three batters in his 4 ¹/₃ innings of work.
Aaron Judge hit a 445-foot home run to center field for his 53rd home run of the season.
Boston starter Brayan Bello's first pitch in the sixth inning darted behind Judge's legs.
The Yankees took three out of four games in the series.
Pre-Game Insights: Boston manager Alex Cora admitted prior to Sunday’s game that the Red Sox had tried to hit Aaron Judge with a pitch in the sixth inning of the previous game.
Post-Match Reflections: Yankees manager Aaron Boone commented on Cora's admission, stating 'That’s not allowed. That’s for someone else to deal with.'
Aaron Judge described his reaction to the pitch behind his legs as 'That’s baseball. He missed. Nothing I could do.'
Aaron Judge mentioned his postgame conversation with Cora as 'a good convo, let’s leave it at that.'
The Yankees finished the homestand with a three-game division lead over the Orioles after going 5-2 in The Bronx.
Gleyber Torres continued to perform well from the leadoff spot.
Carlos Rodon had an excellent performance.
The remade bullpen did the job.
Boone reflected on the confusion in the dugout and took responsibility for it.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This 27-hour slice of life will become a peculiar footnote in the history of The Rivalry.
The Yankees organization has a championship drought since 2009.
